resources.string: Generate notifications for adding to contacts, numbers that were looked up successfully

This program waits for incoming calls and, if the caller's phone number is not in your contacts list, will try to look up the phone number on the internet using the settings specified below.
Some predefined settings are available which can be customized through the options menu.

To test the above settings, you can enter a phone number in the text field below and click the button to force a lookup to be performed.
Note that this lookup does not ignore phone numbers that are already in your contacts list.
Please enter a name for the saved entry:
Are you sure you want to remove this saved entry?
Entry with specified name already exists. Overwrite?
Unable to submit because no e-mail client was found

Custom entry can be specified by entering a URL for a lookup website which includes "%s" (without the quotes), which will be replaced with the incoming caller's phone number, and entering a regular expression which will be used to obtain the caller's name from the lookup website.

E.g. if the URL specified is http://ja.is/m2/?q=%s it will be changed to http://ja.is/m2/?q=5401000 if the incoming caller's phone number is 5401000

Predefined and saved entries can be customized by selecting the menu item "Customize"

Custom entry can be saved by selecting the menu item "Save"

Saved entries can be removed by selecting the menu item "Remove"

Custom entry and saved entries can be submitted for inclusion as predefined entries by selecting the menu item "Submit"

Predefined entries can be updated by selecting the menu item "Update"
